creator: guillaume.lafarge@exalog.com
text:
I compiled httpd-2.2.3 on a linux kernel 2.6.18-1.2798.fc6, plateform is x86_64
with two Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU 1.6Ghz dual core 64bits. Compilation was
difficult, because libexpat is in /usr/lib64 instead of /usr/lib, but I finally
completed compilation.
./configure --prefix=/apache --enable-layout=Apache --enable-so --enable-rewrite
--enable-ssl 
But when I want to start apache apachectl start crashes. The error message is :
apachectl: line 78: 11247 Erreur de segmentation  $HTTPD -k $ARGV

syslog is :
httpd[11247]: segfault at 0000000000000000 rip 000000000049f7c4 rsp
00007fffc1c84178 error 4

with strace :
execve("/apache/bin/apachectl", ["/apache/bin/apachectl", "start"], [/* 21 vars
*/]) = 0

creator: guillaume.lafarge@exalog.com
text:
I rebuilt apache without SSL options :
./configure --with-layout=Apache --prefix=/apache --enable-module=rewrite
and now "apachectl start" works fine. It seems the problem is with SSL ?

The bug came from I built openssl-0.9.7d which is very old. I built
openssl-0.9.8d and now it works fine!
My suggestion : in the configure program, refuse too old versions of openssl..
Also : use /usr/lib64 for libexpat when platform is x86_64
creator: guillaume.lafarge@exalog.com
